page.title: 08St.MARTINS-by-the-GREEN
page.content: St.Martins,built in 1904 at a cost of Â£934,is part of the parish of St. Thomas on the Bourne,and most of the congregation comes from Lower Bourne. Regular services are held at St. Martins, the main one being the communion service at 10.30 a.m. St. Martins has an active and growing choir(mainly girls). The Sunday School for the under 8's is in the process of being reorganised and will reopen on Easter Sunday,1986.St. Martins hall, situated behind the church, is used by the church and local community. The over 60's meet here fortnightly for talks, socials etc. Each Christmas they visit the Bourne First School, where they are entertained by the children and served with tea. The Brownies meet in the hall and they have recently planted a special pine tree in the church grounds.
